definition: Shun (c. 23rd century BC), mythical sage and leader
"claw" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 87)
"cover" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 14), occurring in 軍|军[jun1], 冠[guan1] etc, known as 禿寶蓋|秃宝盖[tu1 bao3 gai4] or 平寶蓋|平宝盖[ping2 bao3 gai4]
mistaken/erroneous/contradictory
Yi Sunshin (1545-1598), Korean admiral and folk hero, famous for sea victories over the Japanese invaders
Yu Shun, one of Five legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4]
several tombs of legendary Emperor Shun, one in Ningyuan county 寧遠縣|宁远县 in southwest Hunan, another Yuncheng prefecture 運城|运城 Shanxi
sage Emperors Shun and Yao rule every day (idiom); all for the best in the best of all possible worlds
sage Emperors Shun and Yao rule every day (idiom); all for the best in the best of all possible worlds

sentences.english: Be up to shun again demanded to see the ancient books.
sentences.chinese: 被關起來的再舜要求見古韻書。

sentences.english: At this point, qiu yun also read aloud to shun the name of the step by step, toward the sea.
sentences.chinese: 此時，秋娟也念着再舜的名字一步一步走向了大海。

sentences.english: The police to the scene could not find Jenny to SiTuShun worried.
sentences.chinese: 警方於現場找不到珍妮二人令司徒舜心急如焚。

sentences.english: In his late years, he demised his position to Sage Shun, who had more abilities than him.
sentences.chinese: 堯的晚年把盟主的位置讓給比自己更有才華的舜。

sentences.english: When Shun cultivated in Mount Li, elephants ploughed for him while birds weeded for him.
sentences.chinese: 舜在厲山耕種，大象替他耕地，鳥代他鋤草。

sentences.english: The water on the ground had been eliminated by the methods of Shun and Yu.
sentences.chinese: 水泡子裏的水被用舜和禹的方法給幹掉了。

sentences.english: Afterwards, Shun didn't resent and was still humble to his father and loved his younger brother.
sentences.chinese: 事後舜毫不嫉恨，仍對父親恭順，對弟弟慈愛。

sentences.english: SiTuShun suddenly receive static Vivian calls, said she is now in the airport.
sentences.chinese: 司徒舜突然接到靜雯來電，說她現在身處機場。

sentences.english: Your hair is still a little wet Sou-chan.
sentences.chinese: 你地頭髮仍然是1個小溼舜泉成龍。

sentences.english: Shun had five ministers, and the empire was well governed.
Shun exiled Gun but promoted his son Yu.
sentences.chinese: 當年舜放逐了鯀卻重用了鯀的兒子禹。

definition: Yu Shun, one of Five legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4]
surname Yao/Yao or Tang Yao (c. 2200 BC), one of Five legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4], second son of Di Ku 帝嚳|帝喾[Di4 Ku4]
Yu the Great (c. 21st century BC), mythical leader who tamed the floods/surname Yu
Di Ku or Emperor Ku, one of the Five Legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4], great-grandson of the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4]
see 大禹[Da4 Yu3]
Yao or Tang Yao (c. 2200 BC), one of Five Legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4], second son of Di Ku 帝嚳|帝喾[Di4 Ku4]
Yu the Great (c. 21st century BC) mythical leader who tamed the floods
Zhuan Xu, one of the Five Legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4], grandson of the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4], trad. reigned 2513-2435 BC
the Yellow Emperor, mythological emperor of China, reigned c. 2697-2597 BC
variant of 鯀|鲧[Gun3]
one of the five legendary emperors, also called 嚳|喾[Ku4]
alternative name for the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝
Flame Emperors (c. 2000 BC), legendary dynasty descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
King Wu of Zhou (-1043), personal name Ji Fa 姬發|姬发, reigned 1046-1043 BC as first king of Western Zhou dynasty 1046-1043 BC
Shang Tang (1646-? BC), legendary founder of the Shang Dynasty

King Wen of Zhou state (c. 1152-1056 BC), reigned c. 1099-1056 BC as king of Zhou state, leading figure in building the subsequent Western Zhou dynasty, father of King Wu of Zhou 周武王[Zhou1 Wu3 wang2] the first Zhou dynasty king
